content.description: The graph below shows three different survivorship curves.
content.question: Scientists determined that a species of a reptile dinosaur cohort had 20% survivorship during the first two years of life, but then the survivorship of those individuals that survived to age 2 had a 70% survivorship to middle age. Survivorship declined later in life. Which of the following best illustrates the shape of the survivorship curve for this species?

choices.label: The figure presents the graph of a survivorship curve. The horizontal axis is labeled “Years,” and the numbers 2 through 12, in increments of 2, are indicated along the axis. The numbers 1, 10, and 100 are evenly spaced from bottom to top along the vertical axis. The survivorship curve begins slightly to the right of the 100 on the vertical axis. It drops steeply to a point with vertical axis value slightly above 1 and horizontal axis value of slightly more than 2. The curve then rises to the right to a point with vertical axis value between 10 and 100, and horizontal axis value of approximately 10. The curve then turns downward slightly and ends at a horizontal axis value of 12.

The figure presents the graph of a survivorship curve. The horizontal axis is labeled “Years,” and the numbers 2 through 12, in increments of 2, are indicated along the axis. The numbers 1, 10, and 100 are evenly spaced from bottom to top along the vertical axis. The survivorship curve begins on the vertical axis at 100. It moves down and to the right in a straight line to a point with vertical axis value slightly below 10 and horizontal axis value between 8 and 10. It then moves vertically downward in a straight line to a point with vertical axis value slightly above 1 and horizontal axis value between 8 and 10. It then moves almost horizontally to the right in a straight line to a point with vertical axis value slightly above 1 and horizontal axis value of 12.

The figure presents the graph of a survivorship curve. The horizontal axis is labeled “Years,” and the numbers 2 through 12, in increments of 2, are indicated along the axis. The numbers 1, 10, and 100 are evenly spaced from bottom to top along the vertical axis. The survivorship curve begins on the vertical axis at 100. It moves steeply down and to the right at first and then levels off at a point with vertical axis value between 10 and 100 and horizontal axis value of approximately 2. It then moves almost horizontally to the right for a short distance, and then slopes gradually downward until it ends at a point with vertical axis value slightly above 1 and horizontal axis value of 12.

The figure presents the graph of a survivorship curve. The horizontal axis is labeled “Years,” and the numbers 2 through 12, in increments of 2, are indicated along the axis. The numbers 1, 10, and 100 are evenly spaced from bottom to top along the vertical axis. The survivorship curve begins on the vertical axis at 100. It moves to the right in a straight line to a point with a vertical axis value of 100 and a horizontal axis value of 12. It then moves vertically downward in a straight line to a point with a vertical axis value of 1 and a horizontal axis value of 12.

content.answer: The figure presents the graph of a survivorship curve. The horizontal axis is labeled “Years,” and the numbers 2 through 12, in increments of 2, are indicated along the axis. The numbers 1, 10, and 100 are evenly spaced from bottom to top along the vertical axis. The survivorship curve begins on the vertical axis at 100. It moves steeply down and to the right at first and then levels off at a point with vertical axis value between 10 and 100 and horizontal axis value of approximately 2. It then moves almost horizontally to the right for a short distance, and then slopes gradually downward until it ends at a point with vertical axis value slightly above 1 and horizontal axis value of 12.

skill.text: Skill 5.C: Explain patterns and trends in data to draw conclusions.
